intro: Corydalis engelmannii, commonly known as Engelmann's fritillary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branched. Corydalis engelmannii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
